intro: Aylostera canacruzensis, commonly known as the Cerrado aylostera, is a shrub native to the Cerrado biome of Brazil. It is characterized by its woody stems and small, elliptical leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by small, woody fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the seasonal dry and wet periods of its habitat. Aylostera canacruzensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and shelter for various fauna.
